name: SocialIQA
summary: A benchmark for social commonsense reasoning. It consists of 38,000 multiple choice questions about everyday social interactions​:contentReference[oaicite:59]{index=59}. Each question focuses on motivations, reactions, or feelings of people in a short context scenario, with 3 answer options.
size: 37,000+ questions with 3-choice answers​:contentReference[oaicite:60]{index=60} (Train ~33k, Dev 1.1k, Test 1.2k). Also 1,924 unique narrative contexts.
download: Data available via AI2 (social-iqa dataset on GitHub) and on HuggingFace `social_i_qa`.
notes: Built on ATOMIC knowledge graph events. Question types include "What will X do next?", "Why did X do that?", etc. It tests understanding of social dynamics and emotions. Models need to infer beyond the literal text. It’s commonly used to evaluate commonsense reasoning in language models.
